decks.notes: The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push, and powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodletter of Aclazotz. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and pressure the opponent's resources with cards like Sheoldred's Edict and Unstoppable Slasher. The deck's mana base supports a consistent stream of black mana sources to ensure smooth and efficient gameplay.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly cast spells and fill the graveyard in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to the battlefield. This deck focuses on using cheap and efficient spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability and deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. Additionally, the deck includes some disruptive elements such as Spell Pierce and Lightning Axe to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of Treasure Cruise helps refill the hand and maintain card advantage throughout the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using Spirit creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents. It includes disruption spells like Spell Pierce and Spell Queller to control the board while building up a strong board presence with creatures like Supreme Phantom and Skyclave Apparition. The deck also features cards like Sheltered by Ghosts and No More Lies to protect key creatures and maintain tempo. The mana base includes a mix of lands to ensure consistency in playing creatures and spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Transmogrify to turn a cheap creature into a powerful threat like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Mirrex. The deck includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game while setting up for the combo. The inclusion of companions like Jegantha, the Wellspring adds consistency to the deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently assembling the combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with a powerful threat that can quickly close out the game.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Greasefang and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent. The strategy involves disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and removal with cards like Bitter Triumph, while also generating value through Raffine's Informant and Say Its Name. The deck also includes a few additional threats like Overlord of the Balemurk and Altanak, the Thrice-Called, along with some powerful utility cards like Skysovereign, Consul Flagship and Esika's Chariot. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's game plan and ensure smooth gameplay.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap aggressive creatures and using pump spells to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes a companion creature, Jegantha, the Wellspring, to provide additional value. The key strategy is to constantly apply pressure on the opponent, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Heartfire Hero to deal damage while maintaining a strong board presence. This deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a relentless stream of aggressive threats and burn spells.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of low-cost creatures and combat tricks. By using cards like Clever Lumimancer and Favored Hoplite alongside spells like Monstrous Rage and Turn Inside Out, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and push through damage efficiently. Additionally, protection and evasion cards like Gods Willing and Slickshot Show-Off are integrated to ensure the creatures can continue to attack and bypass blockers. Overall, the goal is to win the game through aggressive and strategic combat interactions.
